query.description: This is a gmail query search. Examples of queries include specifying sender (from:amy), recipient (to:david), words in the subject line (subject:dinner), matching multiple terms (from:amy OR from:david), excluding terms (dinner -movie), searching for an exact word or phrase ("dinner and movie tonight"), attachments (has:attachment, filename:pdf), labels (label:friends), and time periods (after:YYYY-MM-DD, before:YYYY-MM-DD). Users can also search by categories (category:updates), message size (larger:10M), and more. When asked vaguely to return the last, latest, or any email from their inbox, use in:inbox to do the lookup.

body_type.description: Specify content's type of the email to draft. It should default to 'html' unless specified otherwise.

name: google_calendar_find_events
description: Finds events in your calendar. Returns up to 25 matching events.

instructions.description: Instructions for running this tool. Any parameters that are not given a value will be guessed based on the instructions.

end_time.description: This field sets the EARLIEST timestamp (lower boundary) to find events. So the events' start_time will be greater than this timestamp: e.g. To find events scheduled for today, the end_time should be set to the earliest of today e.g. To find events scheduled for this week, the end_time should be set to earliest of this week e.g. To find events scheduled for yesterday, the end_time should be set to earliest of yesterday e.g. To find events scheduled for tomorrow, the end_time should be set to earliest of tomorrow

calendarid.description: Select the specified calendar or default to the user's personal calendar which will likely be their name or email address. i.e. reid.robinson@zapier.com OR Reid Robinson. Never use a calendar name with "Birthdays" in it.

start_time.description: This field sets the LATEST timestamp (upper boundary) to find events. So the events' end_time will be less than this timestamp: e.g. To find events scheduled for today, the start_time should be set to 'today at 11:59pm' e.g. To find events scheduled for this week, the start_time should be set to 'this week last day at 11:59pm' e.g. To find events scheduled for yesterday, the start_time should be set to 'yesterday 11:59pm' e.g. To find events scheduled for tomorrow, the start_time should be set to 'tomorrow  11:59pm'

search_term.description: ONLY generate a value for this field if explicitly asked to filter events. Will search across the event name and description. Does not include canceled events. **Note**: Search operators such as `AND` or `OR` do not work here. If you search for more than one word (e.g. `apple banana`) we will only find events with both `apple` *AND* `banana` in them, rather than events that contains `apple` *OR* `banana`. You can also use a negative modifier to exclude terms (example: "-apple")

name: zoom_delete_meeting_recordings

name: zoom_update_zoom_meeting
description: This action updates a Zoom meeting. The user will provide the meeting ID as a required field and the agenda and alternative hosts as optional fields.
